column4: I just installed a fresh copy of 9.04 on a macbook with an NVidia GeForce 8600M GT,   and I'm not seeing anything in the restricted drivers tool.  Any ideas?
open a terminal and type sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade.. when finished try the Hardware drivers tab again to see if it's there.
DON'T use envyng unless you want to break your system later.

if that doesn't work you might need to install the nvidia driver you download directly from their site.. BUT if you do that, anytime there is a kernel upgrade you'll have to reinstall the driver. Not really a big deal if you're comfortable with the terminal.
I did all that and it's still not showing up in System > Administration > Hardware Drivers
after updating did it ask you to restart?
no it didn't
you running gnome or kde?
gnome
I logged out and in again

that would typically do it.. it's weird that nothing is showing up.. ActionParsnip you following this? I think you had mentioned to savid to install the nvidia-glx-180 package but it's still not showing up in hardware drivers.
